newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DSM UPS PAYOUT DESPITE LOWER 1996 PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: DSM UPS PAYOUT DESPITE LOWER 1996 PROFIT.

text.p: Dutch petrochemicals group DSM NV said on Tuesday it would pay a higher dividend despite reporting a 32.7 percent drop in 1996 earnings.
DSM said its 1996 net profit fell to 720 million guilders from 1.07 billion in 1995, with fourth quarter net profit falling to 129 million guilders from 144 million.
But DSM said it was raising its dividend for ordinary shareholders to nine guilders per share from eight in 1995.
Earnings for the first half of 1997 would be comparable to those in the same period of 1996, it said.

"In the markets that are important to DSM demand continues to develop favourably. As far as can be judged at present, margins, in particular those for polymers, will gradually improve," the company said in a statement.
"Based on this, DSM expects that the results for the first half of 1997 will reach a level comparable to that of the first half of 1996," it added.
DSM said full-year 1996 operating profits had been pressured due to lower margins for hydrocarbons and polymers and for the industrial chemicals caprolactam and acrylonitrile.
Analysts said that while overall earnings were in line with an indicative figure issued by DSM in January, the core hydrocarbons and polymers business did better than expected.

"The figures were above expectations, notably due to a better than expected performance of the hydrocarbons/polymers division. The rise in oil prices did not pressure results as much as expected," Peter Schouten of MeesPierson said.
Nils van Elzelingen of NIBStrating said prior to the results he had expected slightly lower profits in 1997 but that he had now revised this to a slight increase.
"Earnings from hydrocarbons and polymers were above my expectations...That will have a positive follow-through effect in 1997," he said.
DSM said that in future it would offer shareholders the opportunity of receiving their dividend in shares, buying back shares in the market for this purpose.
Analysts welcomed this, saying it would give additional support to DSM's share price which was up 4.50 guilders at 189.50 by 1125 GMT.
